Pre-Game Insights: Former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq criticized the fitness standards of the Pakistan team ahead of their T20 World Cup match against India on October 23, 2022.
Pakistan lost their first warm-up match against England, leading to further criticism of their preparation and fitness.
Misbah-ul-Haq highlighted that players like himself, Shoaib Malik, and Younis Khan were more focused on fitness during their playing days.
Misbah-ul-Haq pointed out that there has not been a single fitness test or benchmark for the current team.
Pakistan players suffered from fitness issues during the recently concluded Asia Cup, experiencing cramps in the heat conditions of the UAE.
Misbah-ul-Haq mentioned that the fitness test level during the domestic season is not up to international standards.
Pakistan has not performed well in recent T20 matches, including losing a 7-match T20I series against England.
Pakistan reached the semi-finals of the previous T20 World Cup but have struggled in the T20 format recently.
